channel.title: Auto-Alching (Using an auto clicker)
channel.description:
Hi, my friend recently got me to want to try pking and I decided I will first need vengeance. I am currently 90/94 Magic and already have the alchs bought for 94. He told me that he used an auto-clicker to get 82-99, and that he did it in a foreign world at pest control (because you can't get random events while alching in the boat). However after some research I noticed people actually go on Bot-Hunts, reporting bots and that there are several other people auto-alching in the boats already.
I decided I am going to auto-alch these 4 levels, and I need some information on if this would work or not. I downloaded a program called Random Mouse Clicker. It allows you to set a certain width and height to let your mouse move within the box (so you aren't just sitting there alching on the same spot), and it also has an option for random interval breaks between clicks (so you don't alch every 1400 ms or something).
I was wondering if you would think that just using Gary's Hood auto clicker or using this more complex one would get me by easier. I will be alching at a minigame on a foreign world, which I already have planned out.
Remember, Jagex also allows you to use NumKeys, which wouldn't move your mouse. This is why I am asking whether or not I should have it move within the box.
How can Jagex differ whether it is the actual mouse/NumKeys/or an autoclicker? Is it because of repitition?
Also, how long do you recommend I let this run?
tl;dr - I want to use an auto clicker, should I have the mouse move within a box or just have it sit in one spot. and how long.

item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

I’m done with my alchs now. It’s ridiculous how many other people are doing the same thing there.

item.title: Auto-Alching (Using an auto clicker)
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

BloodRayne:

Honestly, if I was Jagex I’d look for alchers that don’t keep their mouse at the same spot all the time. Most of the people I know that get 99 magic alching legit use mousekeys while watching videos or something, and the mouse stays at the exact same point while clicking. I’d say keep the mouse at the same point for an hour or so maybe, not constantly moving. Whenever you come to your pc, move it a tiny bit.

Honing in on either approach doesn’t work; only players in the know make use of mouse keys – many people out there still think it’s against the game rules to make use of Windows XP/Vista/7 accessibility options (or equivalent accessibility options found in other OS.

Read full topic

@chassy13 wrote:

Unless I am playing Xbox, afk, or sleeping, I alch and earn it myself. Otherwise I run the auto-clicker, just so I can PK sooner. I will probably get 94-99 100% legit though.

Read full topic

item.title: Auto-Alching (Using an auto clicker)
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Eh Pretty Easy, post:24, topic:355281”][quote author=Frell link=topic=451838.msg3313351#msg3313351 date=1282142023]
Throw a couple misclicks in there
[/quote]?

[quote author=Lothy link=topic=451838.msg3313305#msg3313305 date=1282139152]
Doesn’t sound very fun to me, given it’s the same mechanic at the end of the day. Also, if your actual loss was 35m then you’ve spent nearly 5.9gp/xp – alching is usually 2gp/xp or less, and using the enchantment room in the mage training arena with the onyx enchant spell costs a little under 1gp/xp.

Mind you, I suppose it’s chassy you’re talking to, and he has a shit-tonne of money to spend.
[/quote]If I had bought unstrung gold amulets the price would have decreased from 35m to 24m, but I used unstrung symbols instead because I couldn’t be bothered to wait for the gold amulets to buy in ge. While the method may be expensive it’s speed makes up for that: time = money. He could get 94 mage in like 2-3 days tops if he started doing it now, whereas with alching (even with a bot) it would take much longer. I also don’t see any reason for him to risk his account botting a simple skill.

P.S. I’m sure you can get unstrung gold amulets in ge with a couple days of wait and afterwards you can sell them to the rogue in varrock, given that you’ve unlocked him after Summer’s End.[/quote]
It’s easy to do something while alching because you only have to use the 5 key on the numpad. Me personally, I did 95 - 99 in however many days (it took me about 2 days for 98 - 99, just so you’ve got a bit of an idea) – I spent that time watching a whole lot of Criminal Minds episodes. I also had a season or two of House ready, just in case it took a lot longer.

Read full topic

item.title: Auto-Alching (Using an auto clicker)
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[quote=“Eh Pretty Easy, post:20, topic:355281”]Rather than to bot your way to 94 magic, why not do it the legit way? I recently got 80-94 magic using string jewellery (Lunar spells) in FIVE days. The spell gives around 140k xp/hr and is semi-afk, as in you only have to click once and it strings the whole inventory for you (87 xp per cast * amulets in inventory, all afk). The whole thing cost me around 35m just because I didn’t use gold amulets which can be sold back at mid price, meaning that you’d only lose the price of the runes.

1 spell: 2 astrals + water/earth runes, just use a mud battlestaff

Tbh it’s also much more “fun”, since you can talk with others etc.[/quote]

I’ve already bought the alching runes and supplies for 94. Magic has always been one of my least favorite skills to train, and I just want 94 for AGS pking.

Lothy:

Mind you, I suppose it’s chassy you’re talking to, and he has a shit-tonne of money to spend.

I honestly don’t right now, because I still have to sell my 2nd SGS to buy an AGS, which will leave me at around 30m. I would use the stringing method and have only a few mil left.

Read full topic

Also, if your actual loss was 35m then you’ve spent nearly 5.9gp/xp – alching is usually 2gp/xp or less, and using the enchantment room in the mage training arena with the onyx enchant spell costs a little under 1gp/xp.

Mind you, I suppose it’s chassy you’re talking to, and he has a shit-tonne of money to spend. :P[/quote]If I had bought unstrung gold amulets the price would have decreased from 35m to 24m, but I used unstrung symbols instead because I couldn’t be bothered to wait for the gold amulets to buy in ge. While the method may be expensive it’s speed makes up for that: time = money. He could get 94 mage in like 2-3 days tops if he started doing it now, whereas with alching (even with a bot) it would take much longer. I also don’t see any reason for him to risk his account botting a simple skill.

P.S. I’m sure you can get unstrung gold amulets in ge with a couple days of wait and afterwards you can sell them to the rogue in varrock, given that you’ve unlocked him after Summer’s End.

Read full topic

item.title: Auto-Alching (Using an auto clicker)
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Lothy:

Looks alright. Maybe you should use the random location option.

I was thinking that, but when I am alching I don’t move my mouse every single time. I either just leave my mouse there, or I use MouseKeys to click with the 5 key on the numpad (which Jagex allows). I think it would look awkward if the position of my mouse changed every single time.

I also downloaded a program to shut down my computer after a certain time limit, so I don’t have to leave it on ALL night. I am heading to bed now and it will shut off in about 2 hours and 18 minutes.

Read full topic

item.title: Auto-Alching (Using an auto clicker)
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Alright, here is my info.

Location: Soul Wars Bank chest, World 44 (Most populated Soul Wars world)

Auto-clicker information:

autoalchingsettings.jpg753×454

How does it look?

I am switching on and off every day or so, while sometimes I alch by myself for 1-2k+ alchs. Otherwise I will have the auto-clicker do 4-5k alchs.

Do you think that there is a higher risk for leaving this on overnight? Say 2 or 3am - 9 or 10am? I believe it is around 900 or so alchs/hr.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:

pure2ownage:

I used gary’s hoods one and gotten 94magic from 91 in 3 days, Use your POH and stay idle in a clan chat.

I wouldn’t recommend poh because if you get laggy and lose connection for even a sec you get kicked out to house portal.

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:13, topic:355281”]Do it in Soul Wars at the bank chest. No randoms, and make sure you do it in the soul wars world. The world is full 99% of the time, and nearly every user is there at Soul Wars. No possible way someone could see you under everyone.

I did 86-99 mage there with literally no brakes, other than buying more supplies. Auto clicker and no ban ftw :)[/quote]

this

item.title: Auto-Alching (Using an auto clicker)
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:7, topic:355281”]Protip: Idle in a clan chat and join in with their discussion here and there, it legitimises your playtime (in my opinion).

Alching would have to be one of the tougher areas when differentiating between humans and bots because, as you said, there’s little mouse movement. This is my reasoning for seeing the occasional conversation as a way to get away with it.

Oh, and keep it real – if you’re alching more than 8k in a day with no talking, consistently for days at a time, then that would throw up a proverbial red flag for anyone assessing your account imo. Doing 6k alchs a day is still 415k experience, which is a lot.[/quote]

Alright. I am in a clan right now so the clan chat should be no problem. Are you basically saying that I shouldn’t bot overnight? I’d probably auto-alch 5k alchs during the day then, and then do like 2-3k alchs while actually sitting there and actively talking in clan chat?

I think the best thing would be to do the same pixel but change the time interval each click. Since most legit alchers use NumKeys, the mouse would not move making it seem more realistic. Basically the only thing I would have to watch out for is mod wannabes that report.

I botted last night only for like 3-4 hours as I said, and I woke up logged out. I think my internet just went out for a second because it happens every so often, unless someone was messing with me. Hopefully not.

Newty:

Why not use an auto clicker through RSBot and do it at soul wars while babysitting it?

It’s my level 132 account and I have never botted on it, I do not want to risk anything higher than an auto-clicker. Also, what do you mean do it at soul wars? I can’t alch there.

Read full topic
